availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Fleming Rogers (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of S. F. Rogers. Married to Margaret A. Ford Rogers in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on May 21, 1844. Father to Rebecca Rogers, Charles F. Rogers, James Rogers, Willis F. Rogers, M. F. Rogers, and Edward Rogers. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 234A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 713.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 466.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 406A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 45.
"Charles Fleming Rogers (1814-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #50879733, accessed June 25, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50879733.
